message: I'm excited to discuss the sale of this product with you, Bob. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to reach a mutually beneficial agreement. My initial offer is $1000000 for the product.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900000. I believe that's a fair price for the product, considering its value to me.

I understand that you have a certain value in mind for the product, Bob. However, I need to ensure that I get a fair price for it. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to make a profit. My counteroffer is $950000 for the product.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice. However, I was thinking more along the lines of $925000. I believe that's a fair price for the product, considering its value to me.

I understand that you're trying to get a good deal, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to make one more concession, but I need to get closer to my minimum price. My counteroffer is $975000 for the product.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm starting to get concerned that we're getting too far apart. I'm willing to meet you at $925000, but no higher. I believe that's a fair price for the product, and I'm willing to walk away if we can't agree on this price.

I understand that you're firm on your price, Bob, but I'm not willing to give up on the profit I need. I'm going to make one last stand. My counteroffer is $980000 for the product. This is my final concession, and I expect you to meet me at this price or walk away.

Alice, I understand that you're trying to make a last stand, but I'm not willing to meet you at $980000. I've already offered you $925000, and I'm not willing to go any higher. I'm willing to walk away if we can't agree on this price. I'm not interested in buying the product for more than $925000.
